013package org.apache.juneau.dto.swagger;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ArrayUtils.contains;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConverterUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
019import java.util.*;
020
021import org.apache.juneau.*;
022import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.marshaller.*;
025
026/**
027 * Describes a single operation parameter.
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * A unique parameter is defined by a combination of a name and location.
031 *
032 * <p>
033 * There are five possible parameter types.
034 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
035 *    <li><js>"path"</js> - Used together with Path Templating, where the parameter value is actually part of the
036 *       operation's URL.
037 *       This does not include the host or base path of the API.
038 *       For example, in <c>/items/{itemId}</c>, the path parameter is <c>itemId</c>.
039 *    <li><js>"query"</js> - Parameters that are appended to the URL.
040 *       For example, in <c>/items?id=###</c>, the query parameter is <c>id</c>.
041 *    <li><js>"header"</js> - Custom headers that are expected as part of the request.
042 *    <li><js>"body"</js> - The payload that's appended to the HTTP request.
043 *       Since there can only be one payload, there can only be one body parameter.
044 *       The name of the body parameter has no effect on the parameter itself and is used for documentation purposes
045 *       only.
046 *       Since Form parameters are also in the payload, body and form parameters cannot exist together for the same
047 *       operation.
048 *    <li><js>"formData"</js> - Used to describe the payload of an HTTP request when either
049 *       <c>application/x-www-form-urlencoded</c>, <c>multipart/form-data</c> or both are used as the
050 *       content type of the request (in Swagger's definition, the consumes property of an operation).
051 *       This is the only parameter type that can be used to send files, thus supporting the file type.
052 *       Since form parameters are sent in the payload, they cannot be declared together with a body parameter for the
053 *       same operation.
054 *       Form parameters have a different format based on the content-type used (for further details, consult
055 *       <c>http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/interact/forms.html#h-17.13.4</c>):
056 *       <ul>
057 *          <li><js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js> - Similar to the format of Query parameters but as a
058 *             payload.
059 *             For example, <c>foo=1&amp;bar=swagger</c> - both <c>foo</c> and <c>bar</c> are form
060 *             parameters.
061 *             This is normally used for simple parameters that are being transferred.
062 *          <li><js>"multipart/form-data"</js> - each parameter takes a section in the payload with an internal header.
063 *             For example, for the header <c>Content-Disposition: form-data; name="submit-name"</c> the name of
064 *             the parameter is <c>submit-name</c>.
065 *             This type of form parameters is more commonly used for file transfers.
066 *       </ul>
067 *    </li>
068 * </ul>
069 *
070 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
071 * <p class='bjava'>
072 *    <jc>// Construct using SwaggerBuilder.</jc>
073 *    ParameterInfo <jv>info</jv> = <jsm>parameterInfo</jsm>(<js>"query"</js>, <js>"foo"</js>);
074 *
075 *    <jc>// Serialize using JsonSerializer.</jc>
076 *    String <jv>json</jv> = JsonSerializer.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.toString(<jv>info</jv>);
077 *
078 *    <jc>// Or just use toString() which does the same as above.</jc>
079 *    <jv>json</jv> = <jv>info</jv>.toString();
080 * </p>
081 * <p class='bjson'>
082 *    <jc>// Output</jc>
083 *    {
084 *       <js>"in"</js>: <js>"query"</js>,
085 *       <js>"name"</js>: <js>"foo"</js>
086 *    }
087 * </p>
088 *
089 * <ul class='seealso'>
090 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-rest-server.jrs.Swagger">Overview &gt; juneau-rest-server &gt; Swagger</a>
091 * </ul>
092 */
093@Bean(properties="in,name,type,description,required,schema,format,allowEmptyValue,items,collectionFormat,default,maximum,exclusiveMaximum,minimum,exclusiveMinimum,maxLength,minLength,pattern,maxItems,minItems,uniqueItems,enum,multipleOf,*")
094@FluentSetters
095public class ParameterInfo extends SwaggerElement {
096
097   private static final String[] VALID_IN = {"query", "header", "path", "formData", "body"};
098   private static final String[] VALID_TYPES = {"string", "number", "integer", "boolean", "array", "file"};
099   private static final String[] VALID_COLLECTION_FORMATS = {"csv", "ssv", "tsv", "pipes", "multi"};
100
101   private String
102      name,
103      in,
104      description,
105      type,
106      format,
107      pattern,
108      collectionFormat;
109   private Number
110      maximum,
111      minimum,
112      multipleOf;
113   private Integer
114      maxLength,
115      minLength,
116      maxItems,
117      minItems;
118   private Boolean
119      required,
120      allowEmptyValue,
121      exclusiveMaximum,
122      exclusiveMinimum,
123      uniqueItems;
124   private SchemaInfo schema;
125   private Items items;
126   private Object _default;
127   private Set<Object> _enum;
128   private Object example;
129   private Map<String,String> examples;
130
131   /**
132    * Default constructor.
133    */
134   public ParameterInfo() {}
135
136   /**
137    * Copy constructor.
138    *
139    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
140    */
141   public ParameterInfo(ParameterInfo copyFrom) {
142      super(copyFrom);
143
144      this.allowEmptyValue = copyFrom.allowEmptyValue;
145      this.collectionFormat = copyFrom.collectionFormat;
146      this._default = copyFrom._default;
147      this.description = copyFrom.description;
148      this._enum = copyOf(copyFrom._enum);
149      this.example = copyFrom.example;
150      this.exclusiveMaximum = copyFrom.exclusiveMaximum;
151      this.exclusiveMinimum = copyFrom.exclusiveMinimum;
152      this.format = copyFrom.format;
153      this.in = copyFrom.in;
154      this.items = copyFrom.items == null ? null : copyFrom.items.copy();
155      this.maximum = copyFrom.maximum;
156      this.maxItems = copyFrom.maxItems;
157      this.maxLength = copyFrom.maxLength;
158      this.minimum = copyFrom.minimum;
159      this.minItems = copyFrom.minItems;
160      this.minLength = copyFrom.minLength;
161      this.multipleOf = copyFrom.multipleOf;
162      this.name = copyFrom.name;
163      this.pattern = copyFrom.pattern;
164      this.required = copyFrom.required;
165      this.schema = copyFrom.schema == null ? null : copyFrom.schema.copy();
166      this.type = copyFrom.type;
167      this.uniqueItems = copyFrom.uniqueItems;
168
169      this.examples = copyOf(copyFrom.examples);
170   }
171
172   /**
173    * Make a deep copy of this object.
174    *
175    * @return A deep copy of this object.
176    */
177   public ParameterInfo copy() {
178      return new ParameterInfo(this);
179   }
180
181   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
182   protected ParameterInfo strict() {
183      super.strict();
184      return this;
185   }
186
187   /**
188    * Copies any non-null fields from the specified object to this object.
189    *
190    * @param p
191    *    The object to copy fields from.
192    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
193    * @return This object.
194    */
195   public ParameterInfo copyFrom(ParameterInfo p) {
196      if (p != null) {
197         if (p.name != null)
198            name = p.name;
199         if (p.in != null)
200            in = p.in;
201         if (p.description != null)
202            description = p.description;
203         if (p.type != null)
204            type = p.type;
205         if (p.format != null)
206            format = p.format;
207         if (p.pattern != null)
208            pattern = p.pattern;
209         if (p.collectionFormat != null)
210            collectionFormat = p.collectionFormat;
211         if (p.maximum != null)
212            maximum = p.maximum;
213         if (p.minimum != null)
214            minimum = p.minimum;
215         if (p.multipleOf != null)
216            multipleOf = p.multipleOf;
217         if (p.maxLength != null)
218            maxLength = p.maxLength;
219         if (p.minLength != null)
220            minLength = p.minLength;
221         if (p.maxItems != null)
222            maxItems = p.maxItems;
223         if (p.minItems != null)
224            minItems = p.minItems;
225         if (p.required != null)
226            required = p.required;
227         if (p.allowEmptyValue != null)
228            allowEmptyValue = p.allowEmptyValue;
229         if (p.exclusiveMaximum != null)
230            exclusiveMaximum = p.exclusiveMaximum;
231         if (p.exclusiveMinimum != null)
232            exclusiveMinimum = p.exclusiveMinimum;
233         if (p.uniqueItems != null)
234            uniqueItems = p.uniqueItems;
235         if (p.schema != null)
236            schema = p.schema;
237         if (p.items != null)
238            items = p.items;
239         if (p._default != null)
240            _default = p._default;
241         if (p._enum != null)
242            _enum = p._enum;
243         if (p.example != null)
244            example = p.example;
245         if (p.examples != null)
246            examples = p.examples;
247      }
248      return this;
249   }
250
251   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
252   // Properties
253   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
254
255   /**
256    * Bean property getter:  <property>allowEmptyValue</property>.
257    *
258    * <p>
259    * Sets the ability to pass empty-valued parameters.
260    *
261    * <p>
262    * This is valid only for either <c>query</c> or <c>formData</c> parameters and allows you to send a
263    * parameter with a name only or an empty value.
264    *
265    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
266    */
267   public Boolean getAllowEmptyValue() {
268      return allowEmptyValue;
269   }
270
271   /**
272    * Bean property setter:  <property>allowEmptyValue</property>.
273    *
274    * <p>
275    * Sets the ability to pass empty-valued parameters.
276    *
277    * @param value
278    *    The new value for this property.
279    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
280    *    <br>Default is <jk>false</jk>.
281    * @return This object.
282    */
283   public ParameterInfo setAllowEmptyValue(Boolean value) {
284      allowEmptyValue = value;
285      return this;
286   }
287
288   /**
289    * Bean property getter:  <property>collectionFormat</property>.
290    *
291    * <p>
292    * Determines the format of the array if type array is used.
293    *
294    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
295    */
296   public String getCollectionFormat() {
297      return collectionFormat;
298   }
299
300   /**
301    * Bean property setter:  <property>collectionFormat</property>.
302    *
303    * <p>
304    * Determines the format of the array if type array is used.
305    *
306    * @param value
307    *    The new value for this property.
308    *    <br>Valid values:
309    *    <ul>
310    *       <li><js>"csv"</js> (default) - comma separated values <c>foo,bar</c>.
311    *       <li><js>"ssv"</js> - space separated values <c>foo bar</c>.
312    *       <li><js>"tsv"</js> - tab separated values <c>foo\tbar</c>.
313    *       <li><js>"pipes"</js> - pipe separated values <c>foo|bar</c>.
314    *       <li><js>"multi"</js> - corresponds to multiple parameter instances instead of multiple values for a single
315    *          instance <c>foo=bar&amp;foo=baz</c>.
316    *          <br>This is valid only for parameters <c>in</c> <js>"query"</js> or <js>"formData"</js>.
317    *    </ul>
318    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
319    * @return This object.
320    */
321   public ParameterInfo setCollectionFormat(String value) {
322      if (isStrict() && ! contains(value, VALID_COLLECTION_FORMATS))
323         throw new BasicRuntimeException(
324            "Invalid value passed in to setCollectionFormat(String).  Value=''{0}'', valid values={1}",
325            value, Json5.of(VALID_COLLECTION_FORMATS)
326         );
327      collectionFormat = value;
328      return this;
329   }
330
331   /**
332    * Bean property getter:  <property>default</property>.
333    *
334    * <p>
335    * Declares the value of the parameter that the server will use if none is provided, for example a <js>"count"</js>
336    * to control the number of results per page might default to 100 if not supplied by the client in the request.
337    *
338    * (Note: <js>"default"</js> has no meaning for required parameters.)
339    * Unlike JSON Schema this value MUST conform to the defined <c>type</c> for this parameter.
340    *
341    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
342    */
343   public Object getDefault() {
344      return _default;
345   }
346
347   /**
348    * Bean property setter:  <property>default</property>.
349    *
350    * <p>
351    * Declares the value of the parameter that the server will use if none is provided, for example a <js>"count"</js>
352    * to control the number of results per page might default to 100 if not supplied by the client in the request.
353    * (Note: <js>"default"</js> has no meaning for required parameters.)
354    * Unlike JSON Schema this value MUST conform to the defined <c>type</c> for this parameter.
355    *
356    * @param value The new value for this property.
357    * @return This object.
358    */
359   public ParameterInfo setDefault(Object value) {
360      _default = value;
361      return this;
362   }
363
364   /**
365    * Bean property getter:  <property>description</property>.
366    *
367    * <p>
368    * A brief description of the parameter.
369    *
370    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
371    */
372   public String getDescription() {
373      return description;
374   }
375
376   /**
377    * Bean property setter:  <property>description</property>.
378    *
379    * <p>
380    * A brief description of the parameter.
381    *
382    * @param value
383    *    The new value for this property.
384    *    <br><a class="doclink" href="https://help.github.com/articles/github-flavored-markdown">GFM syntax</a> can be used for rich text representation.
385    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
386    * @return This object.
387    */
388   public ParameterInfo setDescription(String value) {
389      description = value;
390      return this;
391   }
392
393   /**
394    * Bean property getter:  <property>enum</property>.
395    *
396    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
397    */
398   public Set<Object> getEnum() {
399      return _enum;
400   }
401
402   /**
403    * Bean property setter:  <property>enum</property>.
404    *
405    * @param value
406    *    The new value for this property.
407    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
408    * @return This object.
409    */
410   public ParameterInfo setEnum(Collection<Object> value) {
411      _enum = setFrom(value);
412      return this;
413   }
414
415   /**
416    * Bean property appender:  <property>enum</property>.
417    *
418    * @param value
419    *    The values to add to this property.
420    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
421    * @return This object.
422    */
423   public ParameterInfo addEnum(Object...value) {
424      _enum = setBuilder(_enum).sparse().add(value).build();
425      return this;
426   }
427
428   /**
429    * Bean property fluent setter:  <property>enum</property>.
430    *
431    * @param value
432    *    The new value for this property.
433    *    <br>Strings can be JSON arrays.
434    * @return This object.
435    */
436   public ParameterInfo setEnum(Object...value) {
437      setEnum(setBuilder(Object.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
438      return this;
439   }

447      return exclusiveMaximum;

478      return this;

482    * Bean property getter:  <property>format</property>.

490      return format;
491   }

494    * Bean property setter:  <property>format</property>.

497    * The extending format for the previously mentioned type.
498    *

502   public ParameterInfo setFormat(String value) {
503      format = value;
504      return this;
505   }
506
507   /**
508    * Bean property getter:  <property>in</property>.
509    *
510    * <p>
511    * The location of the parameter.
512    *
513    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
514    */
515   public String getIn() {
516      return in;
517   }
518
519   /**
520    * Bean property setter:  <property>in</property>.
521    *
522    * <p>
523    * The location of the parameter.
524    *
525    * @param value
526    *    The new value for this property.
527    *    <br>Valid values:
528    *    <ul>
529    *       <li><js>"query"</js>
530    *       <li><js>"header"</js>
531    *       <li><js>"path"</js>
532    *       <li><js>"formData"</js>
533    *       <li><js>"body"</js>
534    *    </ul>
535    *    <br>Property value is required.
536    * @return This object.
537    */
538   public ParameterInfo setIn(String value) {
539      if (isStrict() && ! contains(value, VALID_IN))
540         throw new BasicRuntimeException(
541            "Invalid value passed in to setIn(String).  Value=''{0}'', valid values={1}",
542            value, Json5.of(VALID_IN)
543         );
544      in = value;
545      if ("path".equals(value))
546         required = true;
547      return this;
548   }
549
550   /**
551    * Bean property getter:  <property>items</property>.
552    *
553    * <p>
554    * Describes the type of items in the array.
555    *
556    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
557    */
558   public Items getItems() {
559      return items;
560   }

571    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
572    * @return This object.
573    */
574   public ParameterInfo setItems(Items value) {
575      items = value;
576      return this;
577   }

709   /**

711    *
712    * @param value

714    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.

727    *
728    * <ul class='notes'>
729    *    <li class='note'>
730    *       Parameter names are case sensitive.
731    *    <li class='note'>
732    *       If <c>in</c> is <js>"path"</js>, the <c>name</c> field MUST correspond to the associated path segment
733    *       from the <c>path</c> field in the <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#pathsObject">Paths Object</a>.

848    */

850      return type;
851   }
852
853   /**
854    * Bean property setter:  <property>type</property>.
855    *
856    * <p>
857    * The type of the parameter.
858    *
859    * @param value
860    *    The new value for this property.
861    *    <br>Valid values:
862    *    <ul>
863    *       <li><js>"string"</js>
864    *       <li><js>"number"</js>
865    *       <li><js>"integer"</js>
866    *       <li><js>"boolean"</js>
867    *       <li><js>"array"</js>
868    *       <li><js>"file"</js>
869    *    </ul>
870    *    <br>If type is <js>"file"</js>, the <c>consumes</c> MUST be either <js>"multipart/form-data"</js>, <js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js>
871    *       or both and the parameter MUST be <c>in</c> <js>"formData"</js>.
872    *    <br>Property value is required.
873    * @return This object.
874    */
875   public ParameterInfo setType(String value) {
876      if (isStrict() && ! contains(value, VALID_TYPES))
877         throw new BasicRuntimeException(
878            "Invalid value passed in to setType(String).  Value=''{0}'', valid values={1}",
879            value, Json5.of(VALID_TYPES)
880         );
881      type = value;
882      return this;
883   }

909   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
910   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
911      if (property == null)
912         return null;
913      switch (property) {
914         case "allowEmptyValue": return toType(getAllowEmptyValue(), type);
915         case "collectionFormat": return toType(getCollectionFormat(), type);
916         case "default": return toType(getDefault(), type);
917         case "description": return toType(getDescription(), type);
918         case "enum": return toType(getEnum(), type);
919         case "exclusiveMaximum": return toType(getExclusiveMaximum(), type);
920         case "exclusiveMinimum": return toType(getExclusiveMinimum(), type);
921         case "format": return toType(getFormat(), type);
922         case "in": return toType(getIn(), type);
923         case "items": return toType(getItems(), type);
924         case "maximum": return toType(getMaximum(), type);
925         case "maxItems": return toType(getMaxItems(), type);
926         case "maxLength": return toType(getMaxLength(), type);
927         case "minimum": return toType(getMinimum(), type);
928         case "minItems": return toType(getMinItems(), type);
929         case "minLength": return toType(getMinLength(), type);
930         case "multipleOf": return toType(getMultipleOf(), type);
931         case "name": return toType(getName(), type);
932         case "pattern": return toType(getPattern(), type);
933         case "required": return toType(getRequired(), type);
934         case "schema": return toType(getSchema(), type);
935         case "type": return toType(getType(), type);
936         case "uniqueItems": return toType(getUniqueItems(), type);
937         default: return super.get(property, type);
938      }
939   }
940
941   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
942   public ParameterInfo set(String property, Object value) {
943      if (property == null)
944         return this;
945      switch (property) {
946         case "allowEmptyValue": return setAllowEmptyValue(toBoolean(value));
947         case "collectionFormat": return setCollectionFormat(stringify(value));
948         case "default": return setDefault(value);
949         case "description": return setDescription(stringify(value));
950         case "enum": return setEnum(value);
951         case "exclusiveMaximum": return setExclusiveMaximum(toBoolean(value));
952         case "exclusiveMinimum": return setExclusiveMinimum(toBoolean(value));
953         case "format": return setFormat(stringify(value));
954         case "in": return setIn(stringify(value));
955         case "items": return setItems(toType(value, Items.class));
956         case "maximum": return setMaximum(toNumber(value));
957         case "maxItems": return setMaxItems(toInteger(value));
958         case "maxLength": return setMaxLength(toInteger(value));
959         case "minimum": return setMinimum(toNumber(value));
960         case "minItems": return setMinItems(toInteger(value));
961         case "minLength": return setMinLength(toInteger(value));
962         case "multipleOf": return setMultipleOf(toNumber(value));
963         case "name": return setName(stringify(value));
964         case "pattern": return setPattern(stringify(value));
965         case "required": return setRequired(toBoolean(value));
966         case "schema": return setSchema(toType(value, SchemaInfo.class));
967         case "type": return setType(stringify(value));
968         case "uniqueItems": return setUniqueItems(toBoolean(value));
969         default:
970            super.set(property, value);
971            return this;
972      }
973   }

975   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
976   public Set<String> keySet() {
977      Set<String> s = setBuilder(String.class)
978         .addIf(allowEmptyValue != null, "allowEmptyValue")
979         .addIf(collectionFormat != null, "collectionFormat")
980         .addIf(_default != null, "default")
981         .addIf(description != null, "description")
982         .addIf(_enum != null, "enum")
983         .addIf(example != null, "example")
984         .addIf(examples != null, "examples")
985         .addIf(exclusiveMaximum != null, "exclusiveMaximum")
986         .addIf(exclusiveMinimum != null, "exclusiveMinimum")
987         .addIf(format != null, "format")
988         .addIf(in != null, "in")
989         .addIf(items != null, "items")
990         .addIf(maximum != null, "maximum")
991         .addIf(maxItems != null, "maxItems")
992         .addIf(maxLength != null, "maxLength")
993         .addIf(minimum != null, "minimum")
994         .addIf(minItems != null, "minItems")
995         .addIf(minLength != null, "minLength")
996         .addIf(multipleOf != null, "multipleOf")
997         .addIf(name != null, "name")
998         .addIf(pattern != null, "pattern")
999         .addIf(required != null, "required")
1000         .addIf(schema != null, "schema")
1001         .addIf(type != null, "type")
1002         .addIf(uniqueItems != null, "uniqueItems")
1003         .build();
1004      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
1005   }
1006
1007   /**
1008    * Resolves any <js>"$ref"</js> attributes in this element.
1009    *
1010    * @param swagger The swagger document containing the definitions.
1011    * @param refStack Keeps track of previously-visited references so that we don't cause recursive loops.
1012    * @param maxDepth
1013    *    The maximum depth to resolve references.
1014    *    <br>After that level is reached, <c>$ref</c> references will be left alone.
1015    *    <br>Useful if you have very complex models and you don't want your swagger page to be overly-complex.
1016    * @return
1017    *    This object with references resolved.
1018    *    <br>May or may not be the same object.
1019    */
1020   public ParameterInfo resolveRefs(Swagger swagger, Deque<String> refStack, int maxDepth) {
1021
1022      if (schema != null)
1023         schema = schema.resolveRefs(swagger, refStack, maxDepth);
1024
1025      if (items != null)
1026         items = items.resolveRefs(swagger, refStack, maxDepth);
1027
1028      return this;
1029   }
1030}
